name: Easy Chicken Curry Egg Rolls
author: AliciaMac
summary: These chicken curry egg rolls are delicious and really easy! My husband and I spent a while experimenting until we found the right combination.
ingredients: 1 (5 ounce) skinless, boneless chicken breast, finely chopped
½ cup finely chopped red cabbage
1 tablespoon red curry paste (such as Thai Kitchen®)
½ (16 ounce) package egg roll wrappers (such as Nasoya®)
directions: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil and 1 tablespoon soy sauce in a large saucepan over medium heat
Add chicken and cook until no longer pink, 3 to 5 minutes
Add cabbage, onion, and carrot; cook, stirring occasionally, until softened
Mix remaining soy sauce, mayonnaise, curry powder, curry paste, garlic, and chile powder together in a bowl
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Lightly brush a rimmed baking sheet with some olive oil
Place about 1/4 cup of the chicken mixture diagonally across an egg roll wrapper
Fold the bottom half over the chicken mixture; fold in sides and roll up like a burrito
Repeat until all the chicken mixture and wraps have been used
Place egg rolls seam-side down on the prepared baking sheet
Brush tops and sides of the rolls with remaining olive oil
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 10 to 12 minutes
